articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: Why doesn’t the expanding Universe break the speed of light? - Big Think
articles.description: Just 13.8 billion years after the hot Big Bang, we can see objects up to 46.1 billion light-years away. No, this doesn't violate relativity.

articles.title: New burrowing species of dinosaur unearthed by NC paleontologists - WRAL News
articles.description: A 100-million-year-old dinosaur was unearthed by North Carolina scientists who believe the dinosaur lived in a burrow like an armadillo and grazed like a deer.
